title: Shivpal Singh:India's Medal Run At Military World Games Continues As Shivpal Singh Wins Javelin Gold And Gurpreet Singh Shoots Bronze
text:
India's Medal Run At Military World Games Continues As Shivpal Singh Wins Javelin Gold And Gurpreet Singh Shoots Bronze

India's Medal Run At Military World Games Continues As Shivpal Singh Wins Javelin Gold And Gurpreet Singh Shoots Bronze

Shivpal Singh won gold, while Gurpreet Singh bagged a bronze in their respective fields at the Military World Games.

Shivpal is from Chandauli which is about 30km from Varanasi and is in the Air Force.

Shivpal Singh of Indian Air Force wins gold 🥇 in men's Javelin Throw at the ongoing World Military Games with a best throw of 83.33m. ☺️@IAF_MCC #Wuhan2019 pic.twitter.com/LuHpnccym8 — Abi Upadhyay (@still_amystery) October 24, 2019

He had won silver at the Asian Championships earlier this year.

Gurpreet had a silver at the World Shooting Championships in 2018, finished third.

Anandan Gunasekaran won two gold medals in the Men's disabled 100m and 400m to open India's account. Aneesh Kumarm Surendran Pillai and Virender won gold in different disabled shot put.

Don't Miss 57 K SHARES 17.5 K SHARES 15 K SHARES 9.8 K SHARES 9.5 K SHARES

With Inputs From TOI.
